MCQ: Machine learning is a field of study in artificial intelligence that deals with
Choices: a: developing algorithms that can learn from data | b: developing algorithms that can learn from text | c: developing algorithms that can learn from code | d: developing algorithms that can learn from images

MCQ: Machine learning algorithms can be used to
Choices: a: classify data | b: cluster data | c: predict outcomes | d: all of the above

MCQ: Machine learning is used in a variety of fields, including
Choices: a: natural language processing | b: computer vision | c: speech recognition | d: all of the above

MCQ: Machine learning is not used in
Choices: a: business | b: medicine | c: agriculture | d: none of the above

MCQ: The term machine learning was coined by
Choices: a: Arthur Samuel | b: Alan Turing | c: John McCarthy | d: Marvin Minsky
